snippet: Even competitors in popular sports are likely to find that life after gold is not very lucrative. And for the champions in sports like skeet shooting and archery, the odds are even higher.
abstract: Olympic athletes often find that their careers following the games are not very lucrative, fact that is doubly true for competitors in obscure sports like skeet shooting and archery; only a few breakout stars in mainstream events acquire long-term media attention and corporate sponsorship.
lead_paragraph: Even competitors in popular sports are likely to find that life after gold is not very lucrative. And for the champions in sports like skeet shooting and archery, the odds are even higher.

headline.seo: Olympic Athletes May Win Gold, but a Pot of It Rarely Follows
headline.main: They Win Gold, but a Pot of It Rarely Follows
headline.print_headline: They Win Gold, but a Pot of It Rarely Follows
